ygData.subject: RE: [cantera] Re: bug in config/configure ?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, The default changed from using the Numeric package to using the numarray package for Python s matrix operations. I think you have to set USE_NUMERIC to y

Hi,
   The default changed from using the Numeric package to using the
numa=
rray package for Python's matrix operations. I think you have to set
USE_NU=
MERIC to 'y' in the preconfig file, and then try again.

Best wishes,
Harry=

> Hi group

> I'm trying to write a script which largely=
 automates the 
> download/configureation/build/installation of Cantera on =
the 
> institutes computers (some of the people here are not very fluent in=
 
> installing things on linux).
> 
> A problem I encountered is, that the =
configure script always tries to 
> build the F90 interface, no matter what=
 value BUILD_F90_INTERFACE has.
> I tracked it down into the config/configu=
re script, where the 
> BUILD_F90 variable is assigned correctly 0 or 1. Bu=
t then, further on,

> the latter variable is used in an if statement with =
test -n:
> 
> if test -n ${BUILD_F90}; then
> 
> which will always result i=
n true. If I'm not mistaken, it should read
> 
> if [ $BUILD_F90 =3D 1 ]; t=
hen
> 
> 
> This concerns the source package of version 1.6.0.
